website_summaries.verdict: A powerful and compact UPS hampered by a less-than-perfect rechargeable battery.
pros: Great power output for a desktop UPS
A bright LCD panel is a standout feature at this price point
Includes software to monitor and control UPS, and shut down computer automatically during power failure
cons: Battery life is widely variable, with most lasting through the entire 3-year warranty period and others failing earlier

customer_reviews.title: CyberPower is not the company they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Stay Far Away! See video showing a failure that others have also reported where the unit reports OVERLOAD when clearly it can not be overloaded when you have NOTHING plugged in. If it can fail on something as simple as this...I am then concerned over the charing system...If that fails..you can be in for much larger issues as others have found out.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: CAUGHT ON FIRE STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Power went out yesterday and unit caught on fire. Thankfully i was standing right there. Interestingly enough when I called CyberPower today and said I had a unit that caught on fire the guy didn't even pause and just asked me for my address to send a warranty replacement. He wasn't phased at all that one of their products caught on fire. I then asked him if this is a common occurrence and he replied, it happens sometimes, units fail. That is SHOCKING to me.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Zinn

customer_reviews.title: NOT returnable
customer_reviews.text: Mine was dead out of the box, day 1 (which is fine, things happen). I contacted Amazon and they wanted me to go through the manufacturer, what the hell, I have had it less than a day. They tell me there is no return policy on this item... No were on the product page is this called out. Thought I'd share so you don't run into the same issues I did.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Clinton

customer_reviews.title: Good UPS system, flawed monitoring software
customer_reviews.text: CyberPower has a good reputation for surge protectors so that's why I ordered two of the EC850LCD UPS systems to protect our iMac computers and accessories at home. I'm impressed with how they work, so far. BUT... the software that we downloaded from CyberPower to monitor performance of the UPS units is terribly flawed and adversely affects computer performance. My strong recommendation is to not use CyberPower's software. The UPS systems perform fine without. And, the software causes severe problems akin to a computer virus.
customer_reviews.author: David Henderson

customer_reviews.title: backup power that interrupts itself
customer_reviews.text: purchased this in august 2019. it's been shutting itself off almost once a month for no reason. it has a 3 year warranty so let's see how it goes. i will update on result of warranty claim. update 12/26/2019, Cyberpower contacted me via email for address information to exchange defective unit with replacement. i will update again after replacement unit is given time to be evaluated. update 1/25/2020 replacement has been running over a month now with no issues. rating was also updated. good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: -a|ex

customer_reviews.title: Last time I oder this brand
customer_reviews.text: Have a couple of these, and they have gone bad, and every time I usually get a new one, not knowing that is cheaper changing the batteries :( . Well, I started changing the battery and found it that it was the batteries but the unit itself that has gone bad, three times. I will not buy this brand again UPDATED: I bought a bigger one, 1500 from APC, and its way better than these small ones and the units are more solid.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: It screams
customer_reviews.text: I got this so that some things would still have power when the electricity went out. Last night, the power went out at 1a.m. When this thing loses power, it emits a deafening high-pitched electronic squeal that woke us up on the other side of the house - and it is continuous. I have a migraine today because I was crawling on the ground right over the box screaming at me trying to figure out how to shut the stupid thing off. It is so loud I had to yell to other people while we were all right there. I have no idea what engineer thought that would be a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda M Guidry

customer_reviews.title: Dropped dead during second year,
customer_reviews.text: The only thing connected is the PC and a small LED monitor. Been connected for about 2 years, warranty is 3 Years. I tjust DROPPED DEAD without warning. Strange melting smell as well. I'm afraid this will burn our house down so I would not recommend buying this brand. It will power on fine but now when something is plugged in, instantly goes dead. Likely the battery is weak but only after 2 years whereas the warranty is for 3 years. Waiting for CyberPower to respond and honor the warranty. It's unplugged now so I don't risk burning the house down.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyLee

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to organizing the entertainment center and having the battery backup for the modem which keeps the VoIP running. Yeah, not happening with this junk box. The surge protected\battery back up plugs (6 of them) don't work. At all. Never mind that I have no clue if the unit does what it's supposed to when the power goes out; it doesn't even do what it's supposed to when the power is on.
customer_reviews.author: Becky J Barrow

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Product not made to last and manuf knows this.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY**** if you plan to use for more than the 3 year warranty. I purchased April 2017. June 2020 the unit started shrieking randomly at times. Called tech support who was very kind and responsive. But unfortunately said this unit does not allow for battery replacement. And they don’t expect It to last longer than 5 years. Life expectancy of unit is 3-5yrs. So mine died at 3 years Two months. Nothing he could do to help me. What a waste of money. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: JMStyle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For My Needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to hook my cable modem, router and switch up to so that when the power cuts out for a few minutes , here and there, I don't wind up losing internet connectivity in the house and subsequently get kicked off the VPN while I'm working remotely. This worked perfectly for that. It has already served the exact purpose I bought it for on two separate occasions. Very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: M. Quick

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: I have an iMac and needed an backup battery/surge protector . I have a whole house backup generator so I didn't need a battery with a long backup time. Or so I thought. Only today did I find out from CyberPower IT that this UPS isn't compatible with iMac and it fails to recognize electricity provided by the backup generator. Thus the iMac goes into a hard shutdown which can damage my hard drive. In general I found this all misleading. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Penn Ponder

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: This is the EC850LCD Ecologic UPS, 850VA/510W (12 Outlets) ... Received it on Monday, instantly noticed it was emitting a steady, mid-to-high pitched hum, albeit low volume. But it's there. Working in a quiet office, it becomes unbearable after even a short period. The manufacturer assured me this is abnormal, and sent me a replacement unit. But the replacement unit makes the exact same noise. So, clearly this is a design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Check your system before buying EC850LCD it can't handle 700 watt system
customer_reviews.text: I have a custom-built PC with 3900X 2080Ti dual pump water-cooling and LED lighting. While gaming I draw 600+ watts never over 700 watts according to my Kill-a-Watt. The EC850LCD can't handle it and throws into overload protection mode cutting power completely and abruptly w/o proper close down. I had to buy a bigger UPS to get away from this happening. I ended up with a Cyberpower 1500PFCLCD that can handle the amount of power my system draws. I'm not saying this is a bad UPS it works fine on a smaller system. I'm just throwing out a word of caution to would-be buyers. I took away one star because the 850 is misleading by 100+ watts
customer_reviews.author: Edward W. Yowell

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, which is very good
customer_reviews.text: The CyberPower EC850LCD Ecologic Battery Backup & Surge Protector UPS System works exactly as advertised which is a compliment in my book. It was easy to setup, easy to understand which plugins are used for what purposes, the plugins are spaced out well (not perfectly but I am a stickler about such things) and I expect years of good service from this device.
customer_reviews.author: Krkrjk

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This UPS is flawless, in my opinion. It stays fully charged while serving devices that, together, pull in 91 watts. If the power goes off, this UPS takes over immediately. I didn't notice when it switched from electrical power to battery power.
customer_reviews.author: Bilbo

customer_reviews.title: Good small UPS
customer_reviews.text: Nice low-end UPS for the price. Replaced an old UPS that has finally stopped working properly and would no longer hold a charge. Setting this one up couldn’t have been easier. We are using this to provide just some time to do a proper shutdown of the attached computer. We also have our DSL modem and router connected so that it gives us a little extra time on wi-fi, too. With this load we get about 15 minutes of run time. The optional software takes care of gracefully shutting down the PC automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Craig G Laurer

customer_reviews.title: Don't connect to inverter/generator
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking about running this off of a inverter in a truck don't try it. Followed the instructions and charged it for 8 hours first. Checked to make sure it worked off a 120 wall outlet in a house. I took it out to the truck plugged it into my inverter turned it on plugged my phone in to start charging it started beeping the screen turned off and never came back on. Checked the reset button and everything and the others saying it could start a fire mine got hot af on the bottom for the short period it worked.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Drops Down 40% Battery with 20W load in 1 Min!  Crap product! Waiting for return Label@
customer_reviews.text: Tried out a test after charging it for 12 hours. Used wifi router and fiber modem about 20W load on 510W UPS. Pulled plug and UPS dropped battery to 40% in less than 1 minute! Completely Crap product! Not true 850VA ratings! Totally messed up product. I wont buy any Cyberpower product again. APC is the way to go. Should have listened to my instinct. Anyways hopefully Amazon takes these crap back without much troubles. Its 5 day old and didnt perform its duty.
customer_reviews.author: manan bhatt

customer_reviews.title: constent problem
customer_reviews.text: I have had lots of problems with this item shutting down even when there wasn't anything running. the last one was a APC and it lasted for years. Will be looking to buy another APC.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Buy
customer_reviews.text: only lasted a couple of months keeps blowing off,,,no luck with contacting seller
customer_reviews.author: Mike Meza

customer_reviews.title: Works for garage door backup
customer_reviews.text: My Liftmaster garage doors would not come back online after a power disruption. Chamberlain tech support had no solution except to buy their battery backup units at $100 each. I have three doors so I bought this unit and plug all three into it and it works to keep the circuit energized as well as open and close the door if power is out. I wouldn't try to open more than one door at once due to capacity of the UPS.
customer_reviews.author: Southshore Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works with Synology DS420j
customer_reviews.text: I have this powering a Synology DS420j NAS. I have its USB connected to the NAS and when mains power is interrupted I have the NAS shutdown immediately. It works just as I would expect. After I installed everything I tested it by unplugging the UPS from power and the NAS shutdown automatically within 10sec or so. I also have the NAS send a signal to the UPS to turn itself off after the NAS had safely entered hibernation mode. The UPS successfully shutdown. When power was restored (I plugged it back in) the UPS and NAS booted back up automatically. Even though this UPS wasn't on the list of supported UPSs for this Synology NAS, I say it's compatible.
customer_reviews.author: EE123

customer_reviews.title: A must for electrical equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I have all my computer/electrical equipment plugged into. I am no longer having the electrical issues that I was having only plugged into an older surge only protector. Prevents electrical damage.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Works well for less money
customer_reviews.text: The only thing different from the APC units that are more expensive is the need to charge the battery for 8 hrs before use. That's ok, and for the difference warrants the little inconvenience. Also please note, the VA rating, like the 650 on this unit refers to the maximum power throughput of the unit.The 380 designation is the size of the backup battery.Therefore it is best to match or go larger with the backups rating to the size of the power supply in your system. In my case is a 650 watt Rosewill Capstone. That way the power supply has all the clean energy it can take
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Cyber power issue no help.  Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Bought March 3/19, plugged in Router, Server, Phillips hub etc.. 1st time power surge today, all items plugged into this UPS SHUT DOWN! This UPS didn’t work. Called cyber power technical support 3x NO ANSWER. Help!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Cyberpower 550VA/330W, is not as pictured, doesn't come with the telephone in & out jacks as picture, even when the instruction manual that come with the unit tell you and show you how to connect the telephone to protect your phone. So be aware of this. Other than that unit is as describe. I would like to say that amazon customer service was great, when I call to tell them the problem they quickly replace the unit, but unfortunately the second unit came as the first one. I hope that they will change the picture, the phone jacks was the reason to purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: o.rivera

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need, no complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Using this for my desktop PC, a 40" and a 50" LCD monitors (TV's really). Because of the power drawn, i'm warned from time to time that I'm pulling too much current and that my run time will be around 5 minutes. It's fine for me because I'm running on a system that can shutdown well before the 5 minute mark. It's saved my butt a few times from brown outs and at least one power outage in our area. My only criticism might be that the CyberPower software on the PC is a little cheap looking. Maybe they need a graphic artist to help them spruce up that 90's interface.
customer_reviews.author: Dave N.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Our neighborhood is older and the electrical infrastructure is prone to power surges. A little over three months ago the power surged and went out - while I was on my PC. My USB ports were fried as a result of this issue. So, I decided "enough of this!" I bought this item on recommendation from a co-worker who has similar issues in his neighborhood. Since the purchase and set up, I've not had any issues with safety shutting down my system if the power goes out until the power is restored.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Good so far after two months
customer_reviews.text: Working great so far, two brief power outages (each a couple seconds in duration) in the two months since purchase and this item kept uninterrupted power to the cable box preventing it from entering reset/restart mode which usually lasts four to five minutes. Only downside so far is what can only conclude was a third power outage occurring in middle of the night of unknown duration, and had to reset the power button...no sure why as there was no active power draw during that time except the led time display on cable box, so it should not have run out of battery back-up power. Will give further review after a year of use
customer_reviews.author: kelxl

customer_reviews.title: Junk that is not return eligible. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to run a small incubator for short periods in case of power outages. Incubator uses less than 60w and this piece of junk would only run it for about 15 minutes. Went to return the item and seller will not accept any returns. What? Keep your money and skip buying this trash.
customer_reviews.author: Mellisa Berry

customer_reviews.title: I THINK IT'S GREAT QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: I KNOW THIS UNIT HAS MANY MANY FEATURES. I ONLY USE IT AS A BACK UP. I BROUGHT 2 OF THEM. ONE FOR MY OFFICE AND ONE FOR A CUSTOMER (CONDOMINIUM) THAT NEED TO HAVE THE ELECTRIC DOOR OPENER STAY ACTIVE IN A POWER FAILURE. SO FOR ME IT DOES WHAT I NEED IT FOR. JEFF LYNN
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Lynn

customer_reviews.title: AVOID THE 850.  NO WARRANTY REPLACEMENT!!
customer_reviews.text: Even tho Cyperpower advertises a 3 year warranty, its a repair process you pay to initiate. Would have been nice to know before purchasing. It is Not a replacement warranty. AND, once it fails, support lets you know this one does not have a user replaceable battery. If they or Amazon had mentioned this prior to the sale in the advertising, I would have NEVER bought the stupid thing. And, after you pay to send it back, they let you know if they lose it, too bad, you are just out the unit and your shipping and repair costs plus original purchase price. Just bought another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Terry T.

customer_reviews.title: Classic performance
customer_reviews.text: These things are lifesavers when you live in storm-prone areas. The last one I had burned out after we had an abrupt and long outage The battery was drained completely and the cost to replace that wasn't worth retaining the product - and they are pretty useless without the battery backup. I bought another CyberPower because I've ALWAYS bought their products. I'm not crazy about their pricing or the cost to fix their batteries - hence the 4. If you don't have a battery backup tied into your surge product, you are courting disaster. Some years ago I fried a fairly new computer. Haven't been without a CyberPower since and have never regretted.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shuts down after power loss
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why this unit turns itself off shortly after power is lost. This defeats the purpose of a battery backup! There might be a way to change this through settings, but however it is set up by default makes it useless as a battery backup!
customer_reviews.author: _Pete_

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I started swapping some of my smaller data closet UPS with CyberPower because the enterprise support was so good. I purchased two of these for various areas in my house and they work great. They have a nice warranty on them (note: that you must register.. so don't forget). They look nice and work as designed. They've been put to the test so far and I do not have any complaints. For the price point, I'd recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kadar

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for 1 year
customer_reviews.text: This surge protector worked just OK for 1 year. The Eco mode never worked proper, the battery backup (with a cable modem/router, 1 monitor and 1 PC attached) only lasted an 1.5hr on battery mode, but now my echo mode just fails all of a sudden. Especially bad because i work from home and if my router loses connection I am unable to work.
customer_reviews.author: MWTerrell

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This unit is nothing but trouble. Not once has it ever actually worked. It always goes into overload even if you have nothing plugged into it. It doesn't handle power outages at all (just goes right into overload mode). So what's the point in having it if it doesn't do what it was intended to do? How is this any use? There's no knowing if it even surge protects for all we know.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Total lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: Great for what it was designed for. This unit will give you plenty of time to shutdown your devices so they don't crash. We had been having mini outages back to back causing my cable box to lose its mind and keep resetting itself for hours. You can expect to have 9 minutes to shutdown your TV but you can get 90 minutes to keep your cable and internet box going. Great for small power outages.
customer_reviews.author: Rick O

customer_reviews.title: Works like it says
customer_reviews.text: I have very finnicky power at my house. Spikes, dips, outages, it's nasty. My old PSU in my computer went bad after 2 years of being connected to an old worn-out surge protector. With this UPS, power stays level to my PC, and brief outages go unnoticed. Also, having the software on my computer is great. I like the peace of mind knowing that if the power goes out while I'm not home, the UPS software will initiate a safe shutdown before the battery runs out.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter Ryxen

customer_reviews.title: The most interruptible UPS I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This was my third CyberPower UPS but will definitely be my last. I've had it less than a week and it shuts itself down on just about a daily basis. Not due to overload, usually at about 20% capacity. Battery check passes, plug pull check works fine, it just likes to power down for no reason. Stay away from this item!
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Annoying constant buzzing
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this on black friday and it came in last night; has not stopped buzzing even when nothing is plugged in. The noise is very high frequency and gives me headaches. This was for the PC in my bedroom. I tried to look this up but no answers. I normally use APC UPS and those dont do this.
customer_reviews.author: 6yakuza6yoshi6

customer_reviews.title: UPC for back up of aquarium's airpump
customer_reviews.text: I am using this UPC as a back up power for the air pump for my indoor aquarium. This save my fish few times in the past couple of years while I was absent from the house between 15 to 20 days. Power outage most likely to happen around winter during the X'mas time, or during the summer month where there is Indian Summers where the wind blow is very severe and PG&E will shut off power to prevent wild fires.
customer_reviews.author: Fast RC Boat

customer_reviews.title: Eventually Failed
customer_reviews.text: It did have a good life ordered March 2016 failed September 2019. However my biggest complaint is that it didn’t warn me the battery life was dying. That or it didn’t switch to plugged in power... shouldn’t this be like a laptop that goes from plugged in power then to battery? Seems like one side is battery only and when it fails there is a potential I could’ve lost all my data.
customer_reviews.author: Frop

customer_reviews.title: Failed the first power outage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item a few weeks ago and had a bad storm just this last week that caused the power to go out. When the power went out it turned off and did not switch to battery backup. After the power came back on had to press the reset button to get power to the battery side. The surge only side worked with out being reset. My guess is some sort of internal failure.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Sides

customer_reviews.title: Working well after 6 years
customer_reviews.text: Got it 6 years ago. We had a power outage yesterday. It worked well
customer_reviews.author: fy8h

customer_reviews.title: Big power in a small container.
customer_reviews.text: This little unit does a great job keeping my cable modem and main switch going during any power outage. In today's connected world I know more from facebook than the radio whats happening during a power outage so i depend on this little guy to keep my system powered up and running. I gives me plenty of power and has been running like a top since i put it in. Sure it's a little heavy, but thats because it packs a heck of a runtime for it's size. For a typical pc you'll probably get 10-15 minutes out of it or more. plenty of time to safely shut things down if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M. Wollesen

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, one lasted
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of the Ecologic UPS 850VA units. I really like the simplicity. After two years, one is going strong and will power my desktop computer for about 40 minutes. Plenty of time to get organized and shut down. On the other hand, the second unit, after two years too, will only power my cable modem and router for 5 minutes. Originally, the second unit kept the modem/router going strong for about 90 minutes. Will be testing out the 3 year warranty/return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: Epic engineering fail
customer_reviews.text: Who orient's outlets in this direction? No one for a reason. When plugging in devices with AC to DC adapters (most modems, routers, and other electronics) plug in blocks multiple outlets due to orientation. Why is the cord coming out of the box from the top? The over whelming odds are that the power supply I'm connecting it to will be below where I'm mounting it. This resulted in the cord being short about 10"from what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Cory M Clark

customer_reviews.title: OK but...
customer_reviews.text: The 850 UPS lasted just over three years, no longer covered by warranty, and the UPS no longer works on loss of power (apparently the battery is dead). Cyberpower says no warranty coverage and replacement battery is unavailable. Guess I'll be looking for another UPS.
customer_reviews.author: joemama

customer_reviews.title: Great product but don’t expect to wall mount it
customer_reviews.text: Product itself was great until I went to setup my desk setup. You can only use 2 screw to mount this but not vertically aligned so you can NOT mount it upright using studs because the mounting locks on the vertical holes are opposing and can not function this thing is heavy so I wanted to use studs but it’s not possible with this design. Mounting horizontally is not secure because a bump could cause it to pop of the wall. Oh and if you want to use the bottom holes at all you have to mount it upside down. If this wasn’t past my return date I’d be going back
customer_reviews.author: Drahcir

customer_reviews.title: Annoying -OBNOXIOUS- beep
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I live off grid and needed something to just run my wireless internet for short periods without having to start up a generator, but in all truth it is just way too annoying. I mean really! TWO BEEPS EVERY THIRTY SECONDS? On the plus side it will self start without AC input, so it will run in the mode I need. But unit will definately require some modification to get rid of a truly obnoxious overkill beep behavior. If you aren't skilled enough to perform such -dangerous- surgery, this is not the unit for you.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price, for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I have two computers, just plugged in a third and so far, i'm not even using the full load, I've also got my modem, router, and two external drives plugged in. My old UPS died, batteries we're no good an cost a fortune to replace, this however will work just fine. Enough outlets that will keep my computers going to shut down, and hopefully keep my other equipment running.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon G.

customer_reviews.title: It is like a silent sentinel, it does its job
customer_reviews.text: I have this UPS provide power to my WiFi, so when the power goes out, we can use our tablets to surf the Web, do online shopping, watch movies, the news or read e-books. There is also one for my desktop PC. It can power it up to 1/2 during power outage. This way I never loose my work on the computer. It is also a good surge arrester
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn Bars

customer_reviews.title: UPS Died within a year, and batteries exploded inside and leaked
customer_reviews.text: This UPS unit lasted barely a year until the batteries exploded inside and leaked out, destroying a large patch of carpet. Before this failure it DID operate as it should, however the time on battery power was way less than it should have been, the unit would die after 4 minutes of using battery power with nothing more than a PC attached to it.
customer_reviews.author: SF

customer_reviews.title: Died after 7 months.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, didn't live up to expectations. Bought in Jan 2020, and it crapped out today. LCD screen shows nothing, no power out, just screeching for no reason. No way to silence, tossed it out in my woods, now my dog pees on it. Warranty? Yah, from the manufacturer, but you gotta pay shipping, for this 7 pound brick with batteries, I found it cheaper to buy the Amazon branded UPS.
customer_reviews.author: smurf

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: it works as advertised, and is good quality, nothing cheap or flimsy as far as build quality goes, I put my router on it because of frequent power flickering and variations from the wall and it has totally eliminated all those issues.
customer_reviews.author: Endurfree03

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and well-built. Battery backup works fine but I could not use the ECO function after a long time with tech support. They immediately shipped out a new unit, still couldn't get the ECO turn-off to work. After another long call with tech support, it was determined that my computer did not power off the USB ports when shut down. That is needed for the UPS to recognize that the PC is off. My problem, I guess, but it isn't so important the I mess with the BIOS to see if I can fix it. Otherwise, good product, excellent support.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cutter

customer_reviews.title: Great UPS
customer_reviews.text: I love this UPS it has a great display on the unit and a usb interface. This cyberpower is supporting my HTPC, PS3 and TV with out any issue and I got about 6 min of battery power to run on during an outage. I run arch linux with the pwrstat deamon to read the stats off the UPS and shutdown the pc during low battery states and I have no issues. If you have linux and are looking for a good way to protect you electronics from power irregularity and outages this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Miller

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: It has been plugged up since it was delivered, the power went out Saturday and within 3 minutes the surge was beeping..... Beeping... BEEPING!!!!!!! Then off............................... Since I have made the first comment the power has gone out again n my area.... Again your device did not stay active more than 30 to 45 min!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep your power chair operating in spite of black out
customer_reviews.text: We have a motorized reclining couch. An unexpected power failure caught us off guard with the seats back, the leg rest up and great difficulty wrangling ourselves out of the couch when the power sent off while watching TV. The TV & DVR which have their own ups unit continued just fine, but we were unexpectedly trapped and awkwardly. With our couch now plugged into this ups, we're prepared for the next storm.
customer_reviews.author: Lasolomon

customer_reviews.title: Small is good.
customer_reviews.text: Back in the good old days (the 90s), we had battery backups the size of street-mounted mailboxes. Today, all I backup is my wifi router, my modem, and my landline. Everything else runs on it's own battery. If I need a bigger battery for a longer power outage, I just tap the power ports on my EV.
customer_reviews.author: Sushi Broker

customer_reviews.title: The UPS trips randomley setting off its alarm
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this UPS is pretty bad. Clear day, clean power and only powering a lamp at the time and it trips. Alarm does not stop until you power it off and back on again. Other than that quite annoying "feature" seems to work well. Unfortunately, it was several months before I got around to installing it (and I kept the battery conditioned too), otherwise it would be on its way back as a return.
customer_reviews.author: Landru

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to use for a NAS
customer_reviews.text: Hot gods to use with my NAS since our condo complex has frequent electrical problems. The USB port on the back with send the commands to put the drives to sleep and shut the NAS down after a power failure if you have it set up to do so. Everything works as it should. Will be buying another
customer_reviews.author: Just-Mike92

customer_reviews.title: absolutely essental for anyone with a PC
customer_reviews.text: i bought one of these 2 years ago (older model of same unit) after a power spike killed my gaming PC. i like it so much that i bought another one when i moved. the software interface is easy to use and allows you to monitor power conditions and change at what voltage threshold the UPS kicks in to prevent against damage caused by power sags and surges. if you have a modest gaming PC this will keep that PC running doing basic tasks for about 45 mins or about 10-15 mins while gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Giannola

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: It's in the bedroom corner for the Comcast modem and WiFi router. Display says it should keep them running about 100 minutes. It came in handy recently when it started beeping in the middle of the night which let us notify ComEd of the power outage and we were back in service by morning.
customer_reviews.author: D. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: UPS Shuts Off While In Use
customer_reviews.text: Works fine until utility power fails. After utility power is lost, the UPS itself powers off after 20 or 30 minutes. If you are using the UPS to continue to provide power for charging small devices you will have to restart the UPS by hand. I can understand why Cyberpower did this, but when you're sitting in the dark after a hurricane you need the juice, not some engineer's opinion as to the "correct" usage of the UPS. I am going to see if this functionality is correctable via software configuration, but I'm not confident. I'll provide an update now that I HAVE POWER BACK AFTER IRMA.
customer_reviews.author: Fanboi Est Mort

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for remote network equipment
customer_reviews.text: This device is marketed as protection for network equipment (routers, modems, etc) but is not well suited. In the event of a power outage, it will provide power until the batteries run down. But when power returns, it will not restore power automatically. This can only be done if a computer running their software is connected to manage this function. Of course, networking equipment will NOT run their software so the battery-backed devices just sit forever waiting for manual intervention to turn the UPS back on. Not good for remotely protected equipment. This limitation has been confirmed with their tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Would have liked half the size and half the number of outlets. Just the battery supported surge protected outlets. Seems to be good quality. Worked for a power outage we had a few days ago. Loud alarm alerted me to shut down before the battery would have stopped and computer would have "crashed" closed. Don't know much about battery life and durability as I just got it. It was easy to install, though I don't understand all the functions.
customer_reviews.author: Ishop

customer_reviews.title: Battery IS NOT replaceable.  Very EXPENSIVE and ECO UNFRIENDLY Disposable UPS
customer_reviews.text: Battery IS NOT replaceable. Very EXPENSIVE and ECO UNFRIENDLY Disposable UPS Had I known this I would not have purchased this piece of JUNK designed to be environmentally UNFRIENDLY.
customer_reviews.author: M_

customer_reviews.title: You found it, now take it home
customer_reviews.text: CyberPower UPS' last at least a million years. Ok maybe two million. The point is that year after year of power interruptions caused by weather or construction in the neighborhood, these units (when set up as suggested) will protect your electronics and even power down the ones not currently being used, hence the ECO part in the name. Strongly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzwatkins

customer_reviews.title: IT PROTECTED MY COMPUTER!
customer_reviews.text: the place I live in does not have a stable power supply. It could go off at any time. The last time when it happens, it broke my monitor. So I purchased this UPS power strip. Weeks ago, the power failure happens again, the UPS system WORKS! YEAHHHH i saved my documents and shut done my computer safely. Happy with this UPS power strip.
customer_reviews.author: Ranjusaka

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind?
customer_reviews.text: Purchase two (2) of these for separate PC set ups in different parts of the house. Both appear to operate, no issues ... I can't comment regarding a power failure, as we haven't had one .. "yet". Got these for "Peace of mind"! I'll update this review upon a "real life experience".
customer_reviews.author: amazonfan31

customer_reviews.title: It saved me from data loss 3 days after I purchased it! Happy customer! 😍
customer_reviews.text: I had a power surge while using my desktop, lost all progress in my game. I was so mad! Found this, bought it, got it all hooked up. Super easy, btw. 3 days after I bought this, had another power surge and my desktop just blinked and I was still in my game with zero problems! If the power goes out, I have plenty of time to shut down correctly and wait for power to be restored. It already saved me a big headache! Love it! Would absolutely buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Not a viable option for power outages,it puts out a square SIM wave for whenwhenthe the the battery kicks on instantly turning anything off connected to it lol like you advertised computer friendly and router friendly nope you lose power its off Shitty price for a Shitty product MAKE SURE YOUR UPS BATTARY DOES NOT PUT OUT A simulated square wave!!! It won't support your devices
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really surprised, in a good way.....
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this as I am was APC guy and never had good luck with CyberPower years ago. Boy have they come a long way. LCD Display and lots of backup time. We are protecting a firewall, router, switch and 1 single pc w/17" LCD and 1 ext USB HD with this 850. Easily gets 15+min backup time. I will buy CyberPower again, especially now that specs are better, dollar for dollar, than APC equivalent. Now if they can offer a competitive rackmount server unit........
customer_reviews.author: James Parker

customer_reviews.title: Saved my new smart tv
customer_reviews.text: We have power outages frequently. Our generator comes on about 6 minutes after an outage. Not having the correct battery backup allowed our previous tv to get fried. This one is easy to set up and we like that it beeps to remind you that the power is off.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Great price, purchased this to replace a very old similar unit. Where i live we have frequent power surges and these are a must.
customer_reviews.author: Browniiis

customer_reviews.title: I like the display- as it tells me what I need ...
customer_reviews.text: Based on 1 formal test and 1 brief power outage it performs as advertised. Is attractive. I like the display- as it tells me what I need to know such as % of charge, time remaining. Update March 2016- Now after 3 years of use and many power fails of varying duration no change to initial comments above. My phone and Internet provided by cable company and I use the UPS on the cable modem. Our phones are all wireless so with a phone plugged into the modem we now have phone and Internet during outages.
customer_reviews.author: DAC

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: A bolt of lightning struck a power line outside my house. The Cyberpower worked as stated, and saved me thousands of dollars in equipment damage to my computers, printers, and four cameras. It remained working for over two hours until the power came on.
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Just buy good surge protector and be done with it. UPS will give you more headache than it is worth. I have learned my lesson.
customer_reviews.author: deusex

customer_reviews.title: Wow just horrable and unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: Beeps at random, reboots any system that's is plugged into it. Wont run at all off commercial 25kw generator when all other ups will without issue. Software reporting needs a lot of work and good luck getting battery replacement as this is a none standard little tiny battery. Save yourself some time and damaged equipment and get something else like APC.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy sigel

customer_reviews.title: I did a lot of research and talked to computer experts - they said this was a great unit.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 2-months now and I feel confident that my computer will be O.K. should I have a brown out with electricity. I did a lot of research and talked to computer experts - they said this was a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: knarfrenraff

customer_reviews.title: Too bad smart switches are software controlled only.
customer_reviews.text: I have obstructive sleep apnea, needva backup power source for my BIPAP device, and want one that is smart and eco friendly and therefore turn off unused devices. This does that, but only through their software installed on a computer. I wish the documentation was more clear.
customer_reviews.author: RonMartin

customer_reviews.title: Has never worked since I got it and seems impossible to return
customer_reviews.text: When the power goes out so does this UPS, instantly. I'm surprised my equipment isn't damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Rich L.

customer_reviews.title: It worked right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Yes, there is a little set up that has to be done, but it was rather easy. It doesn't take up a whole lot of real-estate and can some what work as a cord organizer. Great feature is you are able to monitor its status from your desk top.
customer_reviews.author: Manfred Dietze

customer_reviews.title: absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: Should have heeded the reviews. This thing is absolute garbage. Take out of the box and it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: aizaruz

customer_reviews.title: does not have a user replaceable battery!!! but fails to mention this
customer_reviews.text: It worked ok while the the battery lasted which wasn't nearly as long as it should have But I can't replace the battery really... or not easily Do NOT BUY THIS Buy one you one where you can definitely replace the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Visniewski

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, not a returnable item, and HORRIBLE ODOR
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the unit, a horrible odor is coming from the unit. So strong a smell we could not keep it in the office. Probably a new production unit and its a glue, or varnish type of smell. They obviously don't care, someone in QC should have caught it. I'm going to buy another brand of UPS.
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: Bad for small loads.
customer_reviews.text: The UPS is probably OK for large loads. But not for smaller loads. I want to run sub-10W security appliance on it. The problem is the UPS calculates run times based on load and max is 100mins. Even though after 100 mins there is almost full battery available, it turns off - showing capacity of 0. Then you turn it back on(without charging) and it then runs again for 100mins. So basically it probably lacks battery charge circuit?? and that is made up by having a simple timer.
customer_reviews.author: Deepak Mital

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!  Love it!!  Protects our PC, Phone, Internet, and OOMA
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old APC with this. Been using it for months now, and it works great! Do NOT plug a laser printer into one of the "Battery Supported" plugs. They make that pretty clear. When we have brown outs or power surges, it doesn't affect our PC, phone, OOMA box, or Internet! Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime??

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So far (couple months) this has worked great. It has been through one power outage already.
customer_reviews.author: Slider

customer_reviews.title: Great UPS
customer_reviews.text: Great UPS for a great price. I added this one for another location pervious one still works after 3 years (same battery).
customer_reviews.author: CARRYON

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is pretty great. It's incredibly easy to set up and hasn't failed me yet. I've had several minor power outages and no problem continuing playing games or working on my PC. The free software is also easy and intuitive. Not much else can be said about this UPS because it's really simple, but that's what makes it great; it's simple and it works very well. Note: only half of it's outlets are backed by the battery, so keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Aikins

customer_reviews.title: works!
customer_reviews.text: I got this unit, charged up and connected all my devices i needed for battery backup. I had been thinking about testing it but kept getting busy. Yesterday, there appeared to be a rolling power outage in my neighborhood and this unit kept my connected devices up. The power outage was brief, but not losing power was great!
customer_reviews.author: A Prasad

customer_reviews.title: UPS for Garage Door Opener
customer_reviews.text: I have this in front of my Sears Craftsman 1/2 HP garage door opener. Works fine. I am using a LED bulb in the opener to keep the power consumption as low as possible. This is large enough to carry the load and has mounting holes. I mounted the UPS to the ceiling in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: D. McQuestion

customer_reviews.title: Works great and a great price with a helpful lcd display!
customer_reviews.text: The electricity in my apartment has been tripping the circuit fuse a lot lately so needed something to protect my devices and this worked perfectly. I have a full gaming PC, 2.1 Logitech sound system, 2 monitors, and a shredder attached to the battery back up ports and with a full load can keep everything running for 5 mins just enough to get everything shutdown or even just reset the tripped fuse !! :)
customer_reviews.author: NinjaMazz

customer_reviews.title: Noisy UPS Battery
customer_reviews.text: This UPS works and mostly does what it is supposed to do. When there is a power outage my entertainment center keeps on going. The big issue I have is that there is a noisy fan installed in this unit and it makes noise constantly. I have it mounted behind a TV and it makes a constant ticking sound that drove me crazy. I removed the unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Died Just Outside of 3 Year Warranty
customer_reviews.text: It mostly worked, but died just a few months after the 3 year warranty. The battery, which at the time of purchase was replaceable (an important reason for me buying it) is now not replaceable, making the high premium (it was 2x a cheaper brand UPS I was replacing) I paid for it a bad choice.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Wei

customer_reviews.title: lasted!!! it failed 6 years after purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It has made 6 years in my home and it failed after 6 years. way better than expected. I will order another.
customer_reviews.author: travis a poe

product_meta.title: CyberPower EC850LCD Ecologic Battery Backup & Surge Protector UPS System, 850VA/510W, 12 Outlets, ECO Mode, Compact, Uninterruptible Power Supply
product_meta.description: Style:850VA LCD| Pattern Name:UPSA compact UPS with standby topology, the CyberPower Ecologic EC850LCD provides battery backup (using simulated sine wave output) and surge protection for desktop computers, workstations, networking devices, and home entertainment systems. During power interruptions, the EC850LCD offers reliable power protection and battery backup. When the battery backup detects that the computer is off or in sleep mode, computer peripherals connected to the ECO Mode, surge protected outlets will be automatically turned off, reducing power usage and lowering energy costs USB connection required. The EC850LCD comes with a three-year warranty (including coverage of batteries) and a $100,000 Connected Equipment Guarantee.
feature_bullets: 850VA/510W Ecologic Battery Backup Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) System

12 NEMA 5-15R OUTLETS: Six battery backup & surge protected outlets, six surge protected outlets (Three ECO controlled) safeguard desktop computers, workstations, networking devices, and home entertainment systems
MULTIFUNCTION LCD PANEL: Displays immediate, detailed information on battery and power conditions

ECO MODE: When the UPS detects a computer is off or in sleep mode, it will automatically turn off power to computer peripherals connected to ECO mode outlets, reducing power usage and lowering energy costs
3-YEAR WARRANTY INCLUDING THE BATTERY; $100,000 Connected Equipment Guarantee and FREE PowerPanel Personal Edition Management Software (Download)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,138 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #7 in Computer Uninterruptible Power Supply Units
